00002  * @file sync/sync.h
00003  * 
00004  * Sync library interface.
00005  * Defines a library interface to the Sync protocol facilities implemented
00006  * by the Repository

00024 #ifndef CCNS_DEFINED
00025 #define CCNS_DEFINED
00026 
00027 #include <stddef.h>
00028 #include <ccn/charbuf.h>
00029 
00030 #define SLICE_VERSION 20110614
00031 
00032 struct ccns_slice;
00033 struct ccns_handle;
00034 
00035 /**
00036  * ccns_name_closure is a closure used to notify the client
00037  * as each new name is added to the collection by calling the callback
00038  * procedure.  The data field refers to client data.
00039  * The ccns field is filled in by ccns_open.  The count field is for client use.
00040  * The storage for the closure belongs to the client at all times.
00041  */
00042 
00043 struct ccns_name_closure;
00044 
00045 typedef int (*ccns_callback)(struct ccns_name_closure *nc,
00046                              struct ccn_charbuf *lhash,
00047                              struct ccn_charbuf *rhash,
00048                              struct ccn_charbuf *pname);
00049 
00050 struct ccns_name_closure {
00051     ccns_callback callback;
00052     struct ccns_handle *ccns;
00053     void *data;
00054     uint64_t count;
00055 };
00056 
00057 /**
00058  * Allocate a ccns_slice structure
00059  * @returns a pointer to a new ccns_slice structure
00060  */
00061 struct ccns_slice *ccns_slice_create(void);
00062 
00063 /**
00064  * Deallocate a ccns_slice structure
00065  * @param a pointer to a pointer to a ccns_slice structure.  The pointer will
00066  *  be set to NULL on return.
00067  */
00068 void ccns_slice_destroy(struct ccns_slice **sp);
00069 
00070 /*
00071  * Set the topo and prefix fields of a slice
00072  * @param slice is the slice to be modified
00073  * @param t is a charbuf containing the topo prefix (used to route Sync commands)
00074  * @param p is a charbuf containing the prefix
00075  * @returns 0 on success, -1 otherwise.
00076  */
00077 int ccns_slice_set_topo_prefix(struct ccns_slice *slice, struct ccn_charbuf *t,
00078                                struct ccn_charbuf *p);
00079 
00080 /**
00081  * Add a (filter) clause to a ccns_slice structure
00082  * @param slice is the slice to be modified
00083  * @param f is a filter clause ccnb-encoded as a Name
00084  * @returns 0 on success, -1 otherwise.
00085  */
00086 int ccns_slice_add_clause(struct ccns_slice *s, struct ccn_charbuf *f);
00087 
00088 /**
00089  * Construct the name of a Sync configuration slice.
00090  * @param nm is a ccn_charbuf into which will be stored the slice name
00091  * @param s is the slice structure for which the name is required.
00092  * @returns 0 on success, -1 otherwise.
00093  */
00094 int ccns_slice_name(struct ccn_charbuf *nm, struct ccns_slice *s);
00095 
00096 /**
00097  * Read a slice given the name.
00098  * @param h is the ccn_handle on which to read.
00099  * @param name is the charbuf containing the name of the sync slice to be read.
00100  * @param slice is a pointer to a ccns_slice object which will be filled in
00101  *  on successful return.
00102  * @returns 0 on success, -1 otherwise.
00103  * XXX: should name be permitted to have trailing segment?
00104  */
00105 int ccns_read_slice(struct ccn *h, struct ccn_charbuf *name,
00106                     struct ccns_slice *slice);
00107 
00108 /**
00109  * Write a ccns_slice object to a repository.
00110  * @param h is the ccn_handle on which to write.
00111  * @param slice is a pointer to a ccns_slice object to be written.
00112  * @param name, if non-NULL, is a pointer to a charbuf which will be filled
00113  *  in with the name of the slice that was written.
00114  * @returns 0 on success, -1 otherwise.
00115  */
00116 int ccns_write_slice(struct ccn *h, struct ccns_slice *slice,
00117                      struct ccn_charbuf *name);
00118 
00119 /**
00120  * Delete a ccns_slice object from a repository.
00121  * @param h is the ccn_handle on which to write.
00122  * @param name is a pointer to a charbuf naming the slice to be deleted.
00123  * @returns 0 on success, -1 otherwise.
00124  */
00125 int ccns_delete_slice(struct ccn *h, struct ccn_charbuf *name);
00126 
00127 /**
00128  * Start notification of addition of names to a sync slice.
00129  * @param h is the ccn_handle on which to communicate.
00130  * @param slice is the slice to be opened.
00131  * @param nc is the closure which will be called for each new name,
00132  *  and returns 0 to continue enumeration, -1 to stop further enumeration.
00133  *  NOTE: It is not safe to call ccns_close from within the callback.
00134  * @param rhash
00135  *      If NULL, indicates that the enumeration should start from the empty set.
00136  *      If non-NULL but empty, indicates that the enumeration should start from
00137  *      the current root.
00138  *      If non-NULL, and not empty, indicates that the enumeration should start
00139  *      from the specified root hash
00140  * @param pname if non-NULL represents the starting name for enumeration within
00141  *  the sync tree represented by the root hash rhash.
00142  * @returns a pointer to a new sync handle, which will be freed at close.
00143  */
00144 struct ccns_handle *ccns_open(struct ccn *h,
00145                               struct ccns_slice *slice,
00146                               struct ccns_name_closure *nc,
00147                               struct ccn_charbuf *rhash,
00148                               struct ccn_charbuf *pname);
00149 
00150 /**
00151  * Stop notification of changes of names in a sync slice and free the handle.
00152  * @param sh is a pointer (to a pointer) to the sync handle returned
00153  *  by ccns_open, which will be freed and set to NULL.
00154  * @param rhash if non-NULL will be filled in with the current root hash.
00155  * @param pname if non-NULL will be filled in with the starting name
00156  *  for enumeration within the sync tree represented by the root hash rhash.
00157  */
00158 void ccns_close(struct ccns_handle **sh,
00159                 struct ccn_charbuf *rhash,
00160                 struct ccn_charbuf *pname);
00161 
00162 #endif
